dialogues.KIRK:
[1]Commander Sonak... ! SONAK turns with Vulcan imperturbability to face Kirk who steps toward him 
[2]You've received your appointment as Enterprise Science Officer? 
[3]Why aren't you on board? 
[4]Here at Starfleet...? The Enterprise is in final preparation to leave dock... 
[5]Twelve! I'm on my way to a meeting with Admiral Nogura which will not last more than three minutes. Report to me on the Enterprise in one hour. 
[6]I intend to be there following that meeting. Report to me. One hour! And Kirk turns, strides purposefully away. Sonak gazes after him, one eyebrow raised quizzically. 
[7]Why aren't the Enterprise transporters in operation, Mister Scott? 
[8]See that it is.  Take me over, please. Scott is now eying Kirk just a little warily as he fol- lows him into the pod. Kirk's determined expression suggests that some chips are going to fly and Scott does not want to become one of them. 
[9]Mr. Scott, there's an alien object with unbelievable destructive power less than three days away from this planet... Kirk hits a button on the travel pod panel -- the air- lock doors SLAM closed behind them. Then, stepping im- mediately to the front observation window: 
[10]... the only Starship in interception range is the Enterprise! Ready, or not, she launches in twelve hours! Scott throws Kirk an appalled look but is now occupied in sealing the Outer Pod door and manipulating drive controls. CAMERA CONTINUES TO PULL BACK TO REVEAL front of the Pod and arms of the office complex as Pod disconnects and starts to move. 
[11]Two and a half years as Chief of Starfleet Operations may have made me a little stale, Mr. Scott -- but I wouldn't exactly consider myself 'untried.' It takes Scott a moment to comprehend, and Kirk smiles now, nods: 
[12]They gave her back to me, Scotty. Scott peers at him, genuinely surprised -- and pleased. Then: 
[13]I think I can find my way, Ensign. And Kirk moves off, leaving the Ensign gazing at him, relieved. 
[14]Bridge! The turbo-elevator HUMS WITH POWER as it begins hur- tling up. On the wall back of Kirk we SEE an electronic diagram of the Enterprise tracking the elevator's speedy trip to the Bridge. 
[15]I appreciate the welcome; I wish the circumstances were less critical.  Epsilon Nine is monitoring the intruder; keep a channel open to them.  Where is Captain Decker? 
[16]Mr Chekov, assemble the crew on the Rec Deck at 0400 hours. I want to show them what we're facing. And Kirk moves to the elevator, enters, is gone. The moment the elevator doors snap closed: 
[17]Will, let's go over here and talk. He indicates corner. Decker glances bemusedly at Kirk, then turns to Scott: 
[18]I'm taking over the Center seat. I'm sorry, Will. 
[19]I'm replacing you as Captain of the Enterprise. Decker seems shocked into silence; he can only peer at Kirk who reaches tentatively as though to clasp a paternal hand on Decker's shoulder, then withdraws it and continues quickly. 
[20]You'll stay aboard as Executive Officer... a temporary grade reduction to Commander. 
[21]Yes. 
[22]My experience -- five years out there dealing with unknowns like this -- my familiarity with the Enterprise, this crew... 
[23]That's why you're staying aboard. I'm sorry, Will. 
[24]Report to the bridge, Commander. Immediately. Decker EXITS. Kirk waits, collecting his composure as he watches him go. Then Kirk turns to glare at Scott. Interrupted by a flare as something shorts out at the mechanism where Scott and Decker had been working. Technician  reacts, hits an inter- com button fast: 
[25]Starfleet, boost your matter gain; we need more signal! 
[26]Oh, my God...! 
[27]Starfleet, do you have them? A mutter of utter, vacant silence -- and Kirk and Scott look at each other again, their pained faces presaging the answer they already know: 
[28]Starfleet... Kirk. Please... express my condolences to their families. Commander Sonak's can be reached through the Vulcan Embassy. (see Rand's stricken expression There was nothing you could have done, Rand. It wasn't your fault. And before Rand can answer, Kirk leaves the room. 
[29]Turboshaft eight...? 
[30]We'll have to replace Commander Sonak. I'd still like a Vulcan there, if possible... 
[31]You are, Mister Decker. I'm afraid you'll have to double as Science Officer. And Kirk moves on, Decker stands gazing reflectively after him. 
[32]That's all we know about it; except that it's now 2.2 days from Earth. Enterprise is the only Federation starship that stands in its way. 
[33]We assume there is a vessel of some type at the heart of the cloud. Our orders are to intercept, investigate; and take whatever action is necessary... and possible.  ...We can only hope that the life form aboard that vessel reasons as we do. 
[34]Put it on the viewer here...! 
[35]External view...! 
[36]Viewer off. 
[37]Pre-launch countdown will commence in forty minutes. 
[38]Rely we are holding position awaiting final crew replacements. 
[39]And there are no finer navigators in Starfleet, Commander. The last is interrupted by: 
[40]Welcome aboard, Lieutenant. 
[41]Our Exec and Science Officer... 
[42]And in you, too, Lieutenant. 
[43]By all means. 
[44]Oh? I'll see that he beams up...! And he hurries from the bridge, onto the elevator, is gone. A moment of puzzled silence, then:  
[45]Yeoman, what was the problem down there? 
[46]Thank you, Yeoman  Starfleet , this is Captain Kirk. The officer is to be beamed up immediately! 
[47]Well, for a man who swore he'd never return to Starfleet... McCOY  What happened, Captain, sir, was that your revered Admiral Nogura invoked a little known -- and seldom used -- reserve activation clause...  ... in simpler language, Captain, sir, they drafted me! 
[48]They didn't...! Kirk has offered his hand, but McCoy is already flaring: McCOY This was your idea! It was your idea, wasn't it! 
[49]Bones, there's a 'thing' out there -- McCOY -- Why is any object we don't understand called a 'thing'? 
[50]-- headed this way. I need you...  McCOY Were you behind this? 
[51]Bones, I need you badly. Kirk extends his hand again; McCoy delays some moments -- then finally responds. And once done, it is the long hand clasp of two old friends reunited despite their differences. Now McCoy turns to Rand. McCOY Permission to come aboard, sir? 
[52]All decks, this is the Captain. Prepare or immediate departure. 
[53]Maneuvering thrusters, Mister Sulu. 
[54]Hold station. 
[55]Thrusters ahead, Mister Sulu. Take us out. 
[56]Impulse power, Mr Sulu. Ahead Warp point-five. 
[57]Departure angle on viewer. 
[58]Viewer ahead. And viewer IMAGE SWITCHED to show the star patterned space ahead. 
[59]Captain's Log, stardate 7412.6. 2.7 hours from launch... 
[60]... in order to intercept the Intruder at the earliest possible time, we must now risk engaging Warp drive while still within the solar system... End of log. 
[61]Well, Bones, do the new medical facilities meet with your approval? McCOY They do not. It's like working in a damned computer center. 
[62]Programming ready? 
[63]Mister Decker; every minute brings that object nearer Earth!  Engineering! Stand by for Warp Drive. McCoy is watching Kirk, a bit surprised at his abrupt- ness to Decker. 
[64]Engineer, we need Warp speed now! McCOY  You're pushing Jim. Your people know their jobs. Kirk flashes McCoy a glance of annoyance -- then back to using intercom: 
[65]Warp Drive, Mr Scott. McCoy still watches curiously as Kirk turns to the helm: 
[66]Ahead Warp One, Mr Sulu. 
[67]Mr. Decker -- Kirk never finishes the word. At that instant, on the viewer, a WORMHOLE DISTORTION: a sudden SPIRALING OF STARS AND FLUID LIGHT narrowing into a VORTEX into which the Enterprise hurtles. A space trap, a deadly pandemonium of ALARM KLAXONS, BELLS, VOICES: 
[68]Wormhole!... Get us back on impulse power! Full reverse! 
[69]Forcefields up full! Put object on viewer...! 
[70]Time to impact...? 
[71]Mr. Chekov, stand by on the phasers...! 
[72]Warp Drive as soon as possible, Mr. Scott. 
[73]That object out there is less than two days from Earth, Mister Scott. We've got to intercept while it still is out there! 
[74]Mr. Decker, I'd like to see you in my quarters.  You have the conn, Mr. Sulu. McCOY  Mind if I tag along? Kirk gives McCoy an annoyed look, then strides to the elevator. Decker, grim, follows -- McCoy brings up the rear as they EXIT. 
[75]Explanation, Mr. Decker: Why was my phaser order countermanded? 
[76]Then you acted properly, of course. 
[77]You saved the ship. 
[78]Stop competing with me, Decker! 
[79]Granted. 
[80]I trust you will... nursemaid me through these difficulties, Mister? 
[81]Then I won't keep you from your duties any longer, Commander.  Yes, Doctor? Kirk's last line has drowned out Decker's "Aye, sir." McCoy says nothing, waits until Decker is gone and the door closes behind him. Then: McCOY He may not be wrong, Jim. 
[82]Get out of here, Bones. McCOY  As ship's doctor, I am now discussing the subject of command fitness. Kirk's expression hardens. 
[83]Make your point, Doctor. McCOY The point, Captain, is that it's you who's competing...  You pulled every string in the book short of blackmail to get the Enterprise -- maybe even that. And when this mission is over, you have no intention of giving her back. 
[84]I intend to keep her, is that what you're saying, Doctor? McCOY It's an obsession -- that can blind you so far more immediate -- and critical responsibilities. Your reaction to Decker is an example. Kirk studies him a beat; has McCoy touched a nerve? Something Kirk himself might have been unaware of? Kirk starts speaking, but is interrupted by: 
[85]Viewer on. At his VOICE COMMAND, the viewer comes on with AN IMAGE of Uhura at her console. 
[86]For what purpose? On the viewer, Chekov's IMAGE replaces Uhura. 
[87]Very well, Mr. Chekov, see to it. Viewer off. Viewer IMAGE FADES. Kirk turns back to McCoy whose question of Kirk's fitness still hangs there between them. Eye to eye - then, finally: 
[88]Your... opinion has been noted, Doctor.  Is there anything further? McCOY I hope not. Kirk nods, exits. McCoy watches him go, hoping his point has gotten through. 
[89]Spock...! Spock, <u>where</u>...<u>how</u>...? Kirk, smiling, is moving toward Spock with hand out- stretched. But Spock has already turned and moved toward the science console where Decker sits. 
[90]If our Executive Officer has no objections...? 
[91]Mister Chekov, log Mister Spock's Starfleet commission reactivated; list him as Science Officer; both effective immediately. 
[92]Mister Spock, <u>welcome aboard</u>! Spock continues onto the elevator without any acknow- ledgment, leaves. Kirk glances, perplexed, at McCoy. McCoy, equally perplexed, shrugs. McCOY Never look a gift Vulcan in the ears, Jim. 
[93]Captain's Log. Stardate 7413.4. Thanks to Mr. Spock's timely arrival - and assistance... 
[94]... we have the engines rebalanced into full warp capacity. Repair time less than three hours... 
[95]... which means we will now be able to intercept Intruder while still more than a day from Earth. 
[96]Sit down, please. Spock remains standing, addresses Kirk: 
[97]I want him here.  Sit down!  For an instant, it looks like Spock will refuse. Then, he complies but sits formally, rigidly. He ignores McCoy totally. 
[98]You've reported that you felt strong thought emotions. A group of minds from a space vessel? Could you make out any plan, anything to do with Earth? 
[99]Also -- there was nothing in your report about <u>why</u> you're here. 
[100]I inquired about you -- learned you were studying with the Masters... Although Spock has been almost infuriatingly emotionless, his expression shifts slightly. McCoy indicates this: McCOY That flicker of emotion confirms our guess. You failed.  
[101]And whatever you sensed out here.... 
[102]Let it drop, Bones.  You are my Science Officer -- I'll expect an <u>immediate</u> report on anything further you learn or <u>sense</u> from here on. 
[103]I know this has been painful, Spock. For me too. Thank you. Spock EXITS. Kirk and McCoy exchange a troubled look, then EXIT too as CAMERA CENTERS AGAIN ON OBSERVATION WINDOW, the view of space there. 
[104]Full mag on viewer! Sulu hits a control -- viewer seems to ZOOM AHEAD and in the distance we SEE a point of light which grows into the LUMINESCENT CLOUD. The same as seen by the Klingons and Starfleet's Epsilon Nine station. Myster- ious, beautiful, and menacing. 
[105]Linguacode? 
[106]Do <u>not</u> return scan, Mr. Spock! It may be misinterpreted as hostility! 
[107]Negative, We'll take no prov- ocative action. Decker has reacted sharply, disapprovingly, to this: 
[108]No...  ... that could also be misinter- preted as hostile, Mr. Decker.  Cloud composition, Mr. Spock? 
[109]Mr Decker.... 
[110]Mr. Decker, I will not provoke an attack, If that order isn't clear to you... 
[111]I stand corrected Mr. Decker.  Navigator, lay in a conic section flight path into the cloud center; bring us parallel to whatever we find in there... 
[112]Communicated with us <u>how</u>? Spock shakes his head... then reacts as if sensing or theorizing something further. He turns, moves quickly to his console, begins there as if searching for something. Interrupted by another ALARM KLAXON. 
[113]Forcefields <u>now</u>...! Deflectors up full! 
[114]Engineering... what's happening to our forcefields?! 
[115]Mr. Spock? 
[116]Transmit, Mr. Spock! Now! 
[117]Any reply from them? 
[118]Spock, have you sensed anything else? Spock turns, gives the O.S. viewer a glance. Then he shakes head. 
[119]Our... 'insignificance'? All have reacted to this; Kirk exchanges a look with Spock who nods firmly. Then Kirk sees that both Decker and Sulu are throwing him a questioning look. In b.g. McCoy and Chapel have EXITED bridge with Chekov. 
[120]But they understood our messages; they broke off the attack. 
[121]Tactical plot on viewer. 
[122]Opinion, Mister. Spock? 
[123]Mr. Decker... ? 
[124]That thing is twenty hours from Decker glances around, moves close to Kirk so only Spock is able to overhear: 
[125]How do you define <u>unwarranted</u>, <u>mister</u>?! 
[126]Viewer, standard ahead. 
[127]Mr. Sulu, steady as she goes. 
[128]No vessel could generate a powerfield of this magnitude... 
[129]Evaluation, Mister Spock? 
[130]Transmit image of the Alien to Starfleet; advise we are attempting further communication. 
[131]Reduce magnification. Factor 4, Mr. Sulu. 
[132]Adjust parallel course, Navigator. Bring us in to one hundred kilometers distance. Very nervous looks now directed toward Kirk. Even Spock gives him a glance, a raised eyebrow. 
[133]Hold relative position here... Kirk's voice is blotted out by a DEAFENING, SHRILL- ING SOUND, accompanied by a multi-hued point of LIGHT which EXPLODES into BLINDING INTENSITY, obscuring everything for an instant. Overlapping this action, we HEAR: 
[134]<u>No one</u> interfere...! It doesn't seem interested in us -- only the ship...! Kirk's words are never completed as <u>suddenly all the</u> <u>energy tendrils withdraw from all consoles and a</u> <u>larger, more powerful-looking tendril lashes out</u>, <u>snaking into the science console complex</u>. 
[135]<u>Computer off</u>! 
[136]It's running our records! Starfleet strength, Earth defenses... As Decker moves to the main power control, Spock now steps in, his Vulcan strength easily brushing Kirk and Decker aside. Spock clasps his fists above his head, brings it down in a SHATTERING BLOW on the console. It <u>splits open</u>! As the bridge lights dim even more, and as the science console shorts itself out -- and off, Decker confronts Spock: 
[137]Forcefields, full remaining strength...! Total reserve! Appropriate ALARM KLAXONS, and COMPUTER VOICES begin SOUNDING, and all this is lost in a SUDDEN SHRILLING SOUND . For a moment the energy patterns are prominent on the viewer -- and then the PATTERNS VANISHED and the SHRILL SOUND FADES -- and: 
[138]Get someone up here to take the Navigator's station...!  Engineering... full emergency power! 
[139]Delay that order, Scotty...! Disengage all main drive systems! Spock peers in deep concentration at the Main Viewer, trying to sense some clue. Kirk glances at him another moment, then turns to the Main Viewer himself, watches in frustrated helplessness. 
[140]They could have many ways of destroying things, Mr. Decker. 
[141]Viewer ahead. 
[142]Maneuvering thrusters, Mr. Sulu; ahead one third.  Full sensor scan, Mr. Spock; they can't expect us <u>not</u> to look them over now! 
[143]Hold station...! 
[144]Have you been able to analyze <u>any</u> of this...? 
[145]Have a security team meet me at Deck Four main elevator! A moment's reaction from all at this, Kirk hurrying toward elevator, calling: 
[146]Take the conn, Mr. Decker: Hold present position... (gesturing Spock to join him Spock... And Spock rises, joins Kirk and they hurriedly exit, the CAMERA SWINGING BACK to Decker, his perplexed con- cern . 
[147]Who is...'V'ger'...? 
[148]Is V'ger the Captain of the alien vessel? 256A   ANGLE ON THE DOOR - McCOY                                 256A rushing in, concerned: McCOY Jim, what's -- At the sight of 'Ilia", McCoy's words die in his throat -- and his trained eyes have instantly told him some- thing is awry. He unslings his tricorder, aims the sensor unit at "Ilia". As he reads his instruments, his face reveals the results . Meanwhile, from the start: 
[149]Where is Lt. Ilia?  
[150]Why does V'ger travel to the third planet of the solar system directly ahead? 
[151]Find the Creator? <u>What</u> Creator? <u>Whose</u>...!?  What does V'ger want of the 'Creator'... ? 
[152]Who is V'ger? 
[153]The examination is a normal function. 
[154]They had a pattern to follow... 
[155]Ilia's memory, her feelings of loyalty, friendship, obedience... might all be there. 
[156]Commander, we're locked in an alien vessel, six hours from Earth orbit, our only contact with our captors is the probe. If we can control it, persuade it, use it in some way... Interrupted by the SOUND of someone trying to open the locked door behind them. Then a METAL RIPPING SOUND as they whirl to see: 
[157]The Decker-unit can assist you with much greater efficiency...  "Ilia" has seemed about to object -- but now her eyes hold on Decker. Then she nods. 
[158]Carry on with your assignment, Mr. Decker. 
[159]Spock? Concerned about his chances? 
[160]Captain's Log. Stardate 7414.1. Our best estimates place us some four hours from Earth. No significant Ilia memory patterns within the alien probe. This remains our only means of contact with our captor. 
[161]Damn...! McCOY  She needs something else: something much more personal to stimulate memory patterns. Something with a more emotional tie. Kirk reacts to this, reflective. 
[162]Spock...!  Get a fix on his position! 
[163]... I don't want him stopped, Bones; I want him to lead me to whatever's out there...! McCOY And if that 'whatever' has taken over his mind....? 
[164]Then he'll have still led me to it, won't he? And Kirk steps into the airlock door, hits a control -- it begins sliding closed behind him. 
[165]I have him in sight. During which, Kirk touches his thruster controls and blue thruster jet propels him off in the direction indicated. His thrusters come on for a longer period of time as he accelerates to the higher speed necessary to overtake Spock... 
[166]Bridge...! 
[167]Bridge, cancel rescue teams.  Spock, what in the hell are you doing out here! 
[168]Answers to what, Spock? Our dilemma -- or your <u>personal</u> one? Spock does not immediately reply, peers at Kirk through the faceplate a long beat, then abruptly looks away, points off into the distance: 
[169]And these 'sensor-swarms' collect that data, carry it here. 
[170]Klingons... our Epsilon 9 station ... and Ilia!! They seem to be more than just images... 
[171]If this is their ship's data banks, where is the crew? Or is their entire ship automated? 
[172]Spock... 
[173]Spock, if you're right, its mind may be <u>enormous</u>... But Spock pays him no attention, his entire being now focused on the PULSATING GLOW of the "alive" area -- the CAMERA MOVING IN CLOSER TO Spock, as he <u>forces</u> his hand toward that surface, closer, closer. 
[174]Were you right? Spock? V'ger is a living machine...?  
[175]And it considers the Enterprise a living machine: that's why the probe refers to our ship as an entity. 
[176]Know what, Spock? What? But Spock falls back, exhausted -- and McCoy gently tugs at Kirk, AD-LIBBING, <u>"Let him rest, Jim..."</u> Kirk shrugs McCoy away, addresses Spock: 
[177]What should you have known? 
[178]What answers? 
[179]I'll be right there...  I need Spock on the bridge. 
[180]A machine planet...? Sending a machine to Earth looking for its <u>Creator</u>...? McCOY God. Kirk looks at him, then at Spock -- on his feet now -- then at McCoy again: 
[181]'To find the Creator,' the probe said. Find <u>God</u>...? McCOY Isn't that what we're all trying to do...?  All us machines...? Kirk stands facing him another moment, then whirls and steps to the monitor, flips some buttons, and peaks into his communicator. 
[182]Mr. Chekov, Commander Decker's present location? 
[183]I want to make a ship's announcement. But it's to be heard only in Engineering. 
[184]<u>This is the Captain speaking. It</u> <u>appears that the alien ship</u>... <u>V'ger... is NOT a manned vessel</u>... 
[185]High mag, Mr. Sulu! Sulu adjusts the viewer through several IMAGE MAGNI- FICATIONS until we SEE the huge OMINOUS GREEN DEVICES more clearly. 
[186]<u>Why</u>...?! 
[187]<u>Why</u>?! 
[188]The carbon-units are not responsible for that. 
[189]V'ger! If we are lesser beings, we are still, like you, living. And because we are alive, we -- like you -- wish to survive. You must not destroy --  Kirk pauses abruptly: "Ilia" is regarding him blandly, stonily -- not the slightest reaction or response; clearly Kirk's plea is being ignored. Kirk draws in his breath to continue, realizes the futility, turns helplessly to Spock. 
[190]Child...!? 
[191]The carbon--units-know-why-the Creator-has-not-responded. McCOY  Jim...! 
[192]Not until V'ger withdraws the devices orbiting the third planet. 
[193]No. (then to crew commandingly Secure all stations. Clear the bridge. A moment where all are startled at this order -- but no time for questions as just then the ship is ROCKED BY A FURIOUS POWERFUL ERUPTION NEARBY within V'ger. 
[194]That was the order, Mr. Sulu: Clear the bridge. Just then another ERUPTION -- the ship is ROCKED AGAIN. 
[195]Bridge secure all stations! Move out! McCOY Jim, what the hell kind of strategy is <u>this</u>...? Meanwhile, Decker has crossed to Chekov's now abandoned console, checks it. 
[196]If V'ger destroys the Enterprise, the information V'ger requires will also be destroyed.  
[197]Because V'ger is going to destroy all the carbon units on the third planet. 
[198]The information will not be disclosed. And, gesturing the others ahead of him, Kirk starts toward the bridge elevator. "Ilia" calls after him: 
[199]Then V'ger must withdraw its orbiting devices. 
[200]The orbiting devices would be controlled from the point, then...? 
[201]The carbon units' information cannot be disclosed to V'ger's probe... only to V'ger directly. 
[202]The question is, Mr. Decker, <u>is</u> there a next move... 
[203]Resume duty stations, Mr. Decker. As Kirk attends to his console, Deck is at an intercom: 
[204]Well, Mr. Decker, it seems my bluff is being called. 
[205]Mr. Chekov, when do those devices activate? 
[206]Engineering... 
[207]Mr. Scott, be prepared to execute Starfleet order two zero zero five. Hearing this, Spock whirls around -- peers incredulously at Kirk. He appears for a moment to be incensed at Kirk's words. Then he realizes and understands Kirk's position and turns, sadly resigned, back to his work. 
[208]Spock... Spock... Spock does not respond, then Kirk reacts with momentary annoyance, then realizes Spock is totally distracted. Kirk peers at him a moment, then suddenly rises and steps up to: 
[209]Mr. Spock -- I think... Spock moves to face him, turning fully INTO the CAMERA so we can see now, just under Spock's eye: A <u>tear</u>! Welling fom the eye, rolling down his cheek. Kirk is speechless a moment, glances at McCoy who has also witnessed this phenomenon, and started toward Spock; but Kirk gestures McCoy to stay back, as he addresses Spock: 
[210]Not for us? 
[211]There is no alternative. 
[212]'Is this all that I am? Is there nothing more? 
[213]Engineering... Status, Mr. Scott? 
[214]Thank you, Scotty. Stand by. 358   ACROSS KIRK TO McCOY                                       358 as Kirk turns from the intercom and glances at McCoy. Between them a total look of understanding. 
[215]Mr. Scott... on my next signal. 
[216]The point...  
[217]won't have twenty-two <u>seconds</u>; the plan must be implemented upon arrival. 
[218]No! Decker's last word is interrupted by an almost gentle BUMP -- and on the Viewer all perceptible motion has <u>stopped</u>. At the same time: 
[219]Mr. Scott... 
[220]Mr. Scott... we're holding off; there may be a chance... (rises, gestures Spock and McCoy Spock, Bones... He starts for elevator. 
[221]Mr. Decker... I will contact you every five minutes. Otherwise... inform Mr. Scott immediately. 
[222]Mr. Sulu, you have the conn... And Kirk leaves; Decker, his face reflecting a strange, almost eager gratification, hurries after him. 
[223]V'ger plans to literally <u>meld</u> to reduce both itself and the Creator to patterns... 
[224]Our data is being prepared.  
[225]We will answer and present <u>proof</u> of our answer when it is ready! Kirk's words lead to a suggestion of FRUSTRATION in the STORM OF LIGHT AND SOUND around them. 
[226]<u>V'ger</u>, we will bring the Creator to you! <u>Here</u>! 
[227]There's no way to know. V'ger expected it to be a machine -- some single entity. (indicates entire site All of us here may be reduced into patterns... 
[228]Commander... We SEE Decker look up at Kirk's call, then ignore him and go back to inspecting inside the access hatch. At this moment, from Kirk's communicator, a SIGNAL. 
[229]Kirk here. 
[230]Stand by. Transmit it on my orders. The three of them exchange looks -- Kirk, Spock and McCoy exchanging a silent moment of friendship and resignation. Then Kirk lifts his communicator again: 
[231]Enterprise... <u>transmit</u>. 
[232]Enterprise, are you transmitting? 
[233]Confirm code and transmitting frequency. 
[234]Capture God! In order to retrieve V'ger's data, the Creator has to physically come here!... 
[235]Enterprise, I want that signal again. Transmit! Then Kirk touches a control on his tricorder exactly as Decker did earlier. Then he looks up, reacts as he sees Decker holding his own tricorder up -- and a smile playing on Decker's face. 
[236]Spock, we <u>were</u> its answer! 
[237]... and the 'foolish' emotions which drive us? 
[238]Ignore that signal.  Shall we give the Enterprise a proper shakedown, Mr. Scott? 
[239]Ahead Warp One, Mr. Sulu. 
[240]Out there.  Thataway.
dialogues.DECKER:
[1]I thought so! See... the trans- porter sensor was not activated... 
[2]Admiral Kirk...  We're getting a top brass send off...?  She'll launch on schedule if we have to tow her out with our bare hands. Right, Scotty? 
[3]Let me now when the back-up is in place. 
[4]All due respect, sir, I hope this isn't a Starfleet pep talk; I'm just too busy. Kirk eyes Decker -- then decides the best way to say it is plainly, directly. 
[5]You are what...? 
[6]-- You, personally, are assuming command? 
[7]May I ask Why? 
[8]Admiral, this is an almost totally new enterprise. You don't know her a tenth as well as I do. 
[9]No, Admiral. I don't think you are; not one damned bit. I remember when you recommended me for this command. You told me how envious you were, and if only you could find a way to get a starship command again. Well, sir, it looks like you found a way. Kirk is silent a moment, peering levelly at Decker, who returns the gaze with equal intensity. Then: 
[10]None available, Captain. There's no one in fact, who's fully rated on this design. 
[11]Hello, Ilia. 
[12]I was stationed on the Lieutenant's home planet some years ago... Ilia looks from Kirk back to Decker, puzzled at his sleeve stripes. 
[13]Captain Kirk has the utmost confidence in me. Kirk flashes a hard glance at Decker, then toward Ilia too.
